data.title: Thailand seeks release of fishing crew, protests Myanmar attack on boats
data.description: Authorities are negotiating for the release of four Thai crew members arrested with a fishing boat towed to Myanmar and protesting against a gun attack on 15 fishing boats early Friday morning.

data.title: Majority of voters disagree with party dissolution penalty: NIDA Poll
data.description: Nearly 40% say only party execs found guilty of wrongdoing should face political ban

data.title: PM’s popularity above 50% but government’s rating falls in November
data.description: Survey shows score was lower on several indices than in October

data.title: Special lane opens at Rama II Road collapse site outside Bangkok
data.description: SAMUT SAKHON: The Highways Department on Sunday opened a reversible lane to relieve outbound traffic on Rama II Road that was affected by the elevated road collapse from last Friday.

data.title: Five districts in Phatthalung still battling floods after heavy rains
data.description: Slow drainage of water into Songkhla Lake blamed for the situation

data.title: Flooding eases in Hat Yai but parts of southern Thailand still under water
data.description: Hat Yai, the economic hub in Thailand

data.title: Landslide hits southern Thailand's Betong
data.description: YALA: A landslide happened in Betong district in this southern border province on Sunday morning. No one was injured.

data.title: Energy Ministry working to tackle gas, fuel shortage in South: Pirapan
data.description: Minister attributes rerouting of transportation due to flooding for the delay

data.title: Critics question Laos dam project's impact on Thailand
data.description: Environmentalists have raised concerns about a 100-billion-baht  dam  project on the lower section of the  Mekong River  in  Laos , warning of adverse effects on the livelihoods of those living on both sides of the Thai-Lao border.

data.title: India imposes anti-dumping duty on import of ECH from Thailand
data.description: Thai exporters have appealed against the claim that the import of Epichlorohydrin was affecting local industry

data.title: Cool to cold weather to persist in most parts of Thailand
data.description: Southern monsoon weakening, but lower South to receive heavy rains

data.title: UNAIDS report: Upholding human rights is key to ending the AIDS pandemic
data.description: Asia Pacific seeks to lower HIV-related stigma and rights violations through education about U=U

data.title: Israel warns citizens of terror threat in Southeast Asia with focus on Thailand
data.description: Israel warned its citizens that the threat of terrorism against them in Southeast Asia has intensified.

data.title: Online scams related to charity and aid activities ‘a serious problem’
data.description: NESDC report flags social issue that exploits people’s compassion

data.title: How to save up to 5 hours weekly with Car Call App and Pre-Booking
data.description: Bangkok’s traffic congestion ranks 12th globally and tops Asia, per INRIX. Thailand leads as the world’s most traffic-congested country. Bangkok residents face 64.1 hours of delays annually, incurring 5.5 billion baht in fuel costs each year.

data.title: Bangchak launches 14th Greenovative Forum, highlighting AI for sustainability
data.description: Bangchak, in partnership with The Standard, hosted the 14th Greenovative Forum at True Digital Park West to mark its 40th anniversary. Titled "Crafting Tomorrow’s Future with Sustainable Energy and AI," experts discussed AI's role in a sustainable energy future.

data.title: Southeast Asia businesses battle more than 24M on-device threats in H1 2024
data.description: On-device threats stem from malware via USB drives, CDs, DVDs, or files entering systems in non-open forms like encrypted files or complex installers. Kaspersky detected and blocked over 24M such threats in Southeast Asia during the first half of 2024.

data.title: Thai government donates 3M baht in aid to UN for refugees and displaced people
data.description: At a ceremony at the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Thailand confirmed 1M baht contributions to UNICEF, UNHCR, and WFP. The funds will support these UN agencies in delivering essential aid to refugees and forcibly displaced populations worldwide.

data.title: Public health depends on human rights
data.description: As a trained HIV physician, it has been inspiring to witness the steady development of ever-more effective treatments for HIV. The continual expansion of proven HIV prevention tools has resulted in lifesaving benefits for so many people.

data.title: 'Influential ties' not a factor in land probe, says Narumon
data.description: Agriculture and Cooperatives Minister Narumon Pinyosinwat has vowed to take action against any encroachment of Sor Por Kor agricultural reform land by a romantic partner linked to a former deputy prime minister.

data.title: Kaspersky: Southeast Asia businesses battle more than 24M on-device threats in H1 2024
data.description: On-device or local, threat incidents are caused by malware spread via removable USB drives, CDs and DVDs, or by files that initially made their way onto the computer in non-open form (for example, programs in complex installers, encrypted files, etc.) Companies in Southeast Asia encountered more than 24 million on-device threats in the first six months of 2024. From January to June this year, Kaspersky Business Solutions detected and blocked 24,289,901 threats of this kind

data.title: Taiwanese leader in Hawaii after declaring Taiwan a force for global peace
data.description: Taiwanese President Lai Ching-te began a US stopover in Hawaii on Saturday as part of a Pacific tour after declaring his democratically governed island a key force for promoting global peace and stability.

data.title: Prachuap held at home by Swat Cats in action-packed T1 thriller
data.description: Hosts PT Prachuap shared a point with Nakhon Ratchasima, who were reduced to 10 men late in the match, following an exciting 2-2 draw on Friday night.

data.title: No good deed; polite thief strikes; body on roof saga
data.description: The owner of a BMW who pawned his vehicle in Nonthaburi has gone to police after the garage which helped arrange the financing refused to pay a repair bill when it was later involved in an accident.

data.title: Doubles duo earn shot at another title
data.description: Mixed doubles players Dechapol Puavaranukroh and Supissara Paewsampran will be having a second shot a World Tour title in a space of two weeks after reaching the final of the US$210,000 BWF Syed Modi India International 2024 in Lucknow on Saturday.

data.title: Critics question Laos dam project
data.description: Environmentalists have raised concerns about a 100-billion-baht  dam  project on the lower section of the  Mekong River  in  Laos , warning of adverse effects on the livelihoods of those living on both sides of the Thai-Lao border.

data.title: Phuket to tackle food waste crisis
data.description: Phuket has introduced a food waste management initiative aimed at reducing waste by 15 tonnes daily as part of its effort to become a low-carbon destination.

data.title: Online gambling sites lure over 4m young Thais
data.description: More than four million young Thai people have been drawn into online gambling, which risks developing into an addiction that takes a toll on their health, according to experts.

data.title: Rama II motorway construction put on hold after fatal crane collapse
data.description: Transport Minister Suriya Jungrungreangkit has ordered work on a city motorway to be suspended for two weeks after Friday

data.title: Flood death toll rises to nine in South
data.description: SONGKHLA - The death toll from the worst floods in decades in southern Thailand climbed to nine on Saturday, as thousands of people were evacuated due to rising water levels.

data.title: 31 crew from Thai boats ‘taken into Myanmar’
data.description: More than 30 crew members of Thai  fishing boats  were detained in  Myanmar  waters on Saturday after three Myanmar patrol vessels opened fire on them, leaving one person dead and two injured, a navy commander said.

data.title: Boat with 110 Rohingya arrives in Indonesia
data.description: JAKARTA - More than 110 Rohingya refugees came ashore in Aceh province of Indonesia on Saturday after their boat nearly sank, UN refugee agency officials and the local government said, as growing numbers arrive by sea in the country.

data.title: German woman bitten by fish in Phangnga
data.description: PHANGNGA - Authorities have issued a warning to tourists in Takua Pa district of this southern Thai province after a German tourist was bitten by an unidentified fish, leaving an oval-shaped wound approximately 20 centimetres long.

data.title: Two fake policemen nabbed
data.description: Two Thai men have been arrested for posing as police to rob Vietnamese tourists in Bangkok.
